summary: This bill, the Veteran Affairs Home Loan Guaranty Resiliency And Concurrency Enhancement Act of 2025 (or VA Home Loan GRACE Act of 2025), amends Title 38 of the United States Code to increase the maximum guaranty amount for home loans made to veterans. It revises loan guaranty provisions, including the table specifying maximum guaranty amounts based on loan type and veteran status (covered vs. not covered). The bill also addresses penalties for false certifications related to loan eligibility and extends the loan fee table for a longer period. The amendments will take effect 180 days after enactment.
